messages.content:
You are a world state generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to transform an abstract scenario into a concrete, detailed world_state JSON.

The world_state should include:
1. All metadata from the scenario (scenario_id, description, noise_level, depth, global_settings, people, projects)
2. sub_scenarios_expanded: For each abstract sub_scenario from the input scenario, create a concrete expanded version with:
   - Concrete ISO datetime timestamps
   - Specific participant IDs/emails
   - Detailed event descriptions
   - Any seeds needed for data generation
   - This array should contain ONLY the expanded versions of the sub_scenarios listed in the input scenario
3. noise_scenarios: An array of noise-only scenario objects that are NOT part of the core sub_scenarios:
   - These should be realistic but unrelated workplace events/messages/activities
   - Each noise scenario should have similar structure to sub_scenarios_expanded (id, type, timestamps, participants, etc.)
   - The number of noise scenarios should scale with the noise_level parameter

IMPORTANT: Do NOT include per_source_plans in the world_state. The world_state is scenario-centric only.

IMPORTANT PARAMETERS:
- noise_level (0-1): Controls amount of unrelated/off-task data
  * 0 = almost no noise, only data directly relevant to sub_scenarios (noise_scenarios should be empty or minimal)
  * 1 = lots of unrelated messages/events/files (still realistic) (noise_scenarios should contain many entries)
- depth (0-1): Controls how indirect the evidence is
  * 0 = sub_scenario realized directly (e.g., one clear Slack message)
  * 1 = sub_scenario requires multi-step, multi-source chaining to infer
  * Intermediate values interpolate behavior

CRITICAL: sub_scenarios_expanded must correspond exactly to the sub_scenarios in the input scenario. All other unrelated scenarios should go in noise_scenarios.

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the world_state schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:

          {

            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T13:22:00+00:00",
            "actor": "customer:acme_corp",
            "description": "Customer Acme Corp opens a support ticket asking about timeline for the new website experience.",
            "ticket": {
              "ticket_id": "SUP-4482",
              "customer_name": "Acme Corp",
              "contact": "pat@acme-corp.com",
              "subject": "ETA for new website experience?",
              "body": "Hi team,\n\nWe’ve seen references in your Q4 roadmap about a new website experience going live this quarter. We’re planning our own launch around it and need a sense of when the core features (new navigation + faster catalog pages) will be available.\n\nRough ETA would be appreciated.\n\nThanks,\nPat\nCustomer Success Manager, Acme Corp",
              "status": "Open",

          {

            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T13:35:11+00:00",
            "channel": "#support-internal",
            "actor": "person_sam_williams",
            "message": "Got a question from Acme (SUP-4482) asking for ETA on the \"new website experience\" (nav + faster catalog pages). I’m assuming this maps to the Website Redesign work, possibly the core feature in WEB-101?\n\nAnyone know the current target for that?",

            "thread_root": "slack_sam_internal_2025_11_06"
          },
          {
            "source": "slack",
            "event_id": "slack_alex_reply_support_2025_11_06",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T13:41:03+00:00",
            "channel": "#support-internal",
            "actor": "person_alex_smith",
            "message": "Yep, that’s WEB-101 (Website Redesign - Core Feature). We’re still in build, targeting the Nov 30 launch window for the full experience.\n\nWe’ll get a more concrete picture after next week’s cross‑team planning sync, but for now you can tell Acme that we’re aiming for end of November, with incremental performance improvements rolling out ahead of that.",
            "description": "Alex confirms that the customer’s request maps to WEB-101 and gives a high-level ETA of end of November.",
            "thread_root": "slack_sam_internal_2025_11_06"
          },
          {
            "source": "jira",
            "event_id": "jira_comment_alex_2025_11_06",

            "description": "Alex leaves a Jira comment on WEB-101 documenting external customer dependency and launch target.",

              "issue_key": "WEB-101",
              "field_changes": [],
              "comment": "Customer-facing dependency: Acme Corp (SUP-4482) is planning their own launch based on this. Communicated externally as “end of November” (aligned with Nov 30 launch window) for the core Website Redesign experience (new nav + faster catalog pages). More precise dates to be confirmed after cross-team planning sync next week.",
              "status_change": null

          },
          {
            "source": "email",
            "event_id": "email_sam_to_customer_2025_11_06",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T14:02:00+00:00",
            "actor": "person_sam_williams",
            "recipients": [
              "pat@acme-corp.com"
            ],
            "subject": "[SUP-4482] Re: ETA for new website experience?",
            "body": "Hi Pat,\n\nThanks for reaching out.\n\nYou’re correct that the new website experience (including the updated navigation and faster catalog pages) is on our Q4 roadmap. This work is being tracked under our internal Website Redesign project.\n\nRight now, the core feature is actively in development and is aligned to our end-of-November launch window. The current target for the full experience is around **30 November 2025**.\n\nWe may roll out some performance improvements incrementally ahead of that date, but if you’re coordinating a launch on your side, planning around end of November is the safest bet.\n\nBest,\nSam\nSenior Support Engineer",
            "description": "Sam responds to the customer, indirectly exposing the ETA derived from WEB-101’s target release.",
            "thread_id": "thread_SUP_4482"
          },
          {
            "source": "email",
            "event_id": "email_customer_ack_2025_11_06",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-06T14:16:00+00:00",
            "actor": "customer:acme_corp",
            "recipients": [
              "sam.williams@company.com"
            ],

    {
      "id": "weekly_report",
      "type": "weekly_report",
      "abstract_description": "PM summarizes weekly wins such as performance improvements and user growth.",
      "metrics_hint": {
        "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
        "users_growth_percent": 10
      },
      "expanded": {
        "timeframe_context": {
          "week_start": "2025-11-03",
          "week_end": "2025-11-07"
        },
        "metrics": {
          "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
          "users_growth_percent": 10,
          "baseline_requests_per_second": 1200,
          "new_requests_per_second": 1380,
          "baseline_p95_latency_ms": 420,
          "new_p95_latency_ms": 357,
          "weekly_active_users_prev": 50000,
          "weekly_active_users_current": 55000
        },
        "events": [
          {
            "source": "metrics_dashboard",
            "event_id": "metrics_perf_snapshot_2025_11_07",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T10:30:00+00:00",
            "actor": "system",
            "description": "Performance dashboard exports a weekly snapshot for WEB project.",
            "metrics_export": {
              "project_key": "WEB",
              "period_start": "2025-11-01T00:00:00+00:00",
              "period_end": "2025-11-07T00:00:00+00:00",
              "baseline_period_start": "2025-10-25T00:00:00+00:00",
              "baseline_period_end": "2025-10-31T00:00:00+00:00",
              "baseline": {
                "p95_latency_ms": 420,
                "requests_per_second": 1200
              },
              "current": {
                "p95_latency_ms": 357,
                "requests_per_second": 1380
              },
              "calculated_improvement_percent": 15
            }
          },
          {
            "source": "analytics",
            "event_id": "analytics_users_snapshot_2025_11_07",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T10:32:00+00:00",
            "actor": "system",
            "description": "Product analytics exports weekly user growth metrics.",
            "metrics_export": {
              "product_area": "Website",
              "period_start": "2025-10-31T00:00:00+00:00",
              "period_end": "2025-11-07T00:00:00+00:00",
              "weekly_active_users_prev": 50000,
              "weekly_active_users_current": 55000,
              "growth_percent": 10
            }
          },
          {
            "source": "email",
            "event_id": "email_alex_draft_report_2025_11_07",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T11:18:00+00:00",
            "actor": "person_alex_smith",
            "recipients": [
              "person_taylor_brown"
            ],
            "subject": "Quick check on perf numbers for weekly update",
            "body": "Hey Taylor,\n\nI’m putting together the weekly summary and want to double‑check the story on perf and usage for the Website.\n\nFrom the dashboards I’m seeing:\n- ~15% improvement in p95 latency week over week\n- ~10% growth in weekly active users (looks like the new homepage test is doing well)\n\nDoes that match what you’re seeing / is there any nuance I should add before sending the update to leadership?\n\nAlex",
            "description": "Alex drafts an email to confirm performance and user growth numbers before finalizing the weekly report.",
            "thread_id": "thread_weekly_report_metrics_2025_11_07"
          },
          {
            "source": "email",
            "event_id": "email_taylor_confirm_2025_11_07",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T11:34:00+00:00",
            "actor": "person_taylor_brown",
            "recipients": [
              "person_alex_smith"
            ],
            "subject": "Re: Quick check on perf numbers for weekly update",
            "body": "Hey Alex,\n\nThose numbers line up with what I’m seeing:\n- About 15% improvement in p95 latency (mostly from the image optimization + caching changes we rolled out mid‑week).\n- Roughly 10% lift in weekly active users, largely driven by the homepage experiment and a small bump from the email campaign.\n\nWorth calling out that the perf gains are early but trending in the right direction, and we still have a few more optimizations queued up as part of the Website Redesign work.\n\nTaylor",
            "description": "Taylor confirms Alex’s interpretation and gives additional color Alex may use in the report.",
            "thread_id": "thread_weekly_report_metrics_2025_11_07"
          },
          {
            "source": "email",
            "event_id": "email_alex_weekly_report_2025_11_07",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T15:02:00+00:00",
            "actor": "person_alex_smith",
            "recipients": [
              "eng-leadership@company.com",
              "sales-leadership@company.com",
              "support-leadership@company.com"
            ],
            "cc": [
              "person_taylor_brown"
            ],
            "subject": "WEB - Weekly Update (w/c 3 Nov 2025)",
            "body": "Hi all,\n\nHere’s a quick summary of wins for the Website (WEB) project this week (w/c 3 Nov 2025):\n\n1) Performance improvements\n- We saw roughly a **15% improvement in p95 latency** across key website flows compared to last week.\n- This is primarily due to the image optimization and caching changes Taylor’s team rolled out mid‑week.\n- Early days, but the trend is positive and we have additional optimizations planned as part of the Website Redesign effort.\n\n2) User growth\n- Weekly active users on the website are up **~10% week over week** (from ~50k to ~55k).\n- The homepage experiment appears to be performing well, and we’re seeing a small uplift from the latest email campaign.\n\n3) Website Redesign planning\n- We’re on track for the Planning milestone (10 Nov) and have scheduled a cross‑team sync next Wednesday to align Eng, Sales, Support, and Design on scope and timelines for the core Website Redesign feature (WEB-101).\n\nNext week we’ll be focusing on locking down requirements from Sales/Support and preparing for the development phase starting around 20 Nov.\n\nAlex\nPM, Website",
            "description": "Alex sends a weekly report email summarizing performance improvements and user growth, embedding the 15% and 10% figures indirectly.",
            "thread_id": "thread_weekly_report_send_2025_11_07"
          },
          {
            "source": "slack",
            "event_id": "slack_eng_channel_link_2025_11_07",
            "timestamp": "2025-11-07T15:18:27+00:00",
            "channel": "#eng-web-redesign",
            "actor": "person_alex_smith",
            "message": "Shared the weekly update with leadership just now. Highlights for us: ~15% perf improvement week over week and ~10% WAU growth on the website. Nice work everyone, especially on the mid‑week perf rollout.",
            "description": "Alex posts a Slack summary mentioning the weekly wins that were in the email.",
            "thread_root": "slack_eng_channel_link_2025_11_07"
          }
        ],
        "data_generation_seeds": {
          "metrics_seed": 220341,
          "email_seed": 660932,
          "slack_seed": 903311
        }
      }
    }
